Question
========
A study of reading comprehension compares three research conditions: 1) "text on paper," 2) "text on iPad," and 3) "text and animations on iPad." After reading the text, students take a test that determines how well they understood the text. The researchers used a one-way ANOVA to determine that the mean scores on the test differed for the three study conditions, F(2, 97) = 14.63, p < .001, $\eta^2$ = .23.

Which conclusion is warranted based on the output below?

![](uu-Post-hoc-test-811-nl-graph01.jpg)

Answerlist
----------
* Students in the "Text on iPad" condition scored significantly higher on the test than students in the "Text and animations on iPad" condition.
* Students in the condition "Text on iPad" score significantly lower on the test than students in the other two conditions.
* Students in the "Text on iPad" and "Text and animations on iPad" conditions both score significantly higher on the test than students in the "Text on paper" condition.
* Students in the "Text and animations on iPad" condition score significantly higher on the test than students in the other two conditions.
